name: Iberostar Praia do Forte

reviews.text: stayed at this hotel from may the 29 till june the 11th well what can i say apart from what a brill holiday we all had the rooms were lovely the staff were gr8 the food was fabuolouse my partner had put loads of weight on with the food being so good his jeans that we brought with us wont fit him any more took both my girls with us aged 2 and 5 and they had no problem with eating only down fall to tis hotel was the kids club they did more for the braziliansand didnt speak english so my daughter didnt nderstand so she never went but we still had a good time the entertainment staff on a night work hardbut one really hard worker and good freind to uss now is capacete[william] what a great guy we will miss him very much if any one is going soon please tell him liz craig and the girls send lots of love to him the weather was great to say it was rainy season it only rained twice the drinks were gr8 to no local brands proper barcardi so we got drunk quite alot they are building a new hotel next door but that dont bother you cant hear a thing. went to see the sea turtles which was gr8 . over all a brill holiday would definnatley recomend fanbloodydozey
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a holiday. First week was manic, all the flights and hotels. Where to start, Rio is such an exciting city, with so much to see and do, and in the short space of time we were there we did so much. We did all the usual tourist attractions, but one of the best was going to the Maracana Football staduim on the 31st May for the 1st Leg of the cup final -the fans are so passionate and colourful - what a great atmosphere, if you get the chance go to a match. Then after our 3 days in Rio, it was off to the Igaussu Falls, no words can describe how you feel when you see the Falls for the first time. Stuningly beautiful rainforest with cascading waterfalls, plenty of wildlife, quatis and birds, and the occasional big spider. We had a great tour guide named Rodrigo, spoke fantastic english. TIP: would advise trip to Agentinian side to get up close and personal with the Devils Throat.
reviews.title: Rio, Igussau & Bahia - What a Holiday

likes.disliked: — No tea/coffee making facility in the Bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then it was off to the Iberostar, Bahia - Absolutely no negative points. Food, service - all first class. Cleanliness was excellent, and the rooms very spacious and well equipped. Food and Drink provided i am sure covers all tastes. Weather was excellent, with a couple of overcast days...would recommend high factor protection even if you take a good tan. This was our first visit to the Beautiful country of Brazil, and we will definetly be making a return visit in the near future. All the people we met on our holiday were great, made lots of new friends and had a fabulous well needed holiday.
reviews.title: Cannot fault all the previous positive reviews

likes.liked: — all inclusive values - you get all the international brands as well
likes.disliked: — sun goes down at 17.30 in the evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jim & Loraine McKinnon, Clydebank, Scotland
reviews.title: The perfect Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is there for you, just choose what you want, plenty to do in day and evening......... try the "smokers bar" , not smoky , air conditioned and great bar staff ( never had to queue for long anywhere unlike some previous commentaries - a bom dia and obrigado go a very long way and nearly always bring a smile) ...
reviews.title: Bahia magic Pauline &Tony

likes.disliked: — Bathroom sealant and grouting had mould spots.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a fabulous two week stay at the Iberostar Bahia. THIS IS PARADISE. Everything about the hotel is 1st class and i have very high standards and they were more than met. The food was amazing with enormous choice. The all inclusive drinks menu was the best I have seen and you get an inclusive mini bar in your room with beer, soft drinks and water too.The rooms are all large and very well furnished. As this hotel only opened last year its all still shiny and new !!! We travelled with First Choice from Manchester and it was a very enjoyable 10 hour flight. We upgraded to star class premier but the standard class accomodation looked as good just no free drinks or headphones in there. Would probably only upgrade again if we got it for a good discount ! If you read the other reviews they all say fabulous. Tips go a long way with the staff and will mean you will have no problem getting drinks !!! If you want to go to Rio (we didnt) it was £350pp for two day trip and the feedback we had from other guests was mixed. We did a day trip to Salvador and it was nice to see the cities culture but it is quite poor so expect beggars. We also did a day trip into the jungle which involved canoeing and a visit to a school that was fab. Bring pencils,chalk etc from home if you fancy doing that, the school will be more than appreciative as its run on a shoe string. Have you booked yet ??? DO IT :-)
reviews.title: Book it, Book it, Book it !!!

likes.liked: — it was a lovely large complex very spacious with massive sofas all over the lobby great for chilling on after evening meal !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: superb holiday to brazil. did First Choice 5-day tour to rio and iguassu falls would not have missed this for the world. rio included tour to statue of Christ excellent. did Sugar LoaF mOUNTAin on our own and saw it in daylight (unlike our group, who went with the guide). walked round the lagoon and saw the monkeys in the botanic gardens (well worth seeing). pensioners get in free.
reviews.title: fantastic holiday

likes.disliked: — location a bit isolated. o.k. for us because we had done the 5-day tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: then on to iguassu falls. internal flights - lots of delays. and stopped at Sau Paulo (not informed). guide in iguassu, rodrigo, superb. taken to see brazil side as included excurion. next day paid to go optional tour to Argentina side (must do !!). excellent organisation. option on way to airport to visit bird park, or helicopter flight (only £40 each, wish we had gone).
reviews.title: fantastic trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: then on to iberostar for 9 nights. superb hotel, friendly and efficient staff. spotless. food excellent, so much choice. definitely recommend. but do not miss the 5-day tour. local lvillage 1 hr. walk along beach. well worth a visit. very unspoiled and friendly. - no hard sell. turtle sanctuary worth a visit. (reduction for pensioners again). holiday we would definitely recommend. first choice reps in hotel excellent. could not fault hotel, except a bit isolated. courtesy bus to village would be helpful. nan and barney
reviews.title: Wildlife was amazing

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable rooms. Big choice of swimming pools, beach, food.
likes.disliked: — Weekends when it became more like a 2 star Butlins resot.

reviews.text: We travelled to Brazil with first choice,and did the 5 night tour of Rio & Iguassu first. Rio was a wonderfull city to visit ,we had read a lot about the high crime rates before we went but didn`t experience any problems and felt completely safe. Our tour included a trip to the statue of christ. The sugar loaf mountain trip was extra but we did book it though our guide. We were supposed to see the sunset from sugarloaf but when we got there it was dark and raining so we didn`t get to see the views or the sunset. The next day we got a taxi there for 15 reals and paid 35 reals each entrance fee and saw amazing views of Rio. (it was also a lot less than we paid to go with the guide).
reviews.title: My View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour of Brazil with First Choice. We were really impressed with all aspects of this hotel and it definitely exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived really late at night, but even so, the check in process was easy and quick, and despite the time we were even able to get decent food.
reviews.title: Big and beautiful - Iberostar, take note, no expansion needed!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance and reception are really grand, with very high ceilings and really impressive decor.
reviews.title: won"t return

reviews.text: There are a variety of restaurants here- there is a main buffet restaurant which had an amazing selection of foods, which all tasted really fresh. Even though they were catering for so many people the food was really impressive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are also 3 speciality restaurants which have to be booked in advance, but you can usually book these either on the day or a few days in advance. We found that the Japanese restaurant was really impressive and ate here a couple of times. The chef cooks the food at your table and it is really entertaining. We also ate at the Brazilian restaurant a couple of times. The starter is a buffet, and for the main course you have a baked potato and the waiters bring round a variety of cuts of meat, and slice them at your table, and they will just keep bringing meat until you are full.
reviews.title: beyond your drems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed jan/Feb 2007 this this is one of the best hotels ever.
reviews.title: super dupa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service & food was excellent ,try speaking some Portugese and you will be waited on like Royalty.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel & Fantastic Country

reviews.text: superb pools and beach.
reviews.title: Superb hotel
loved the staff
reviews.text: There were only about 30 brits on site which was brilliant,most others Portugese, some from Peru and Argentina all were extremly friendly many speak English including children.

likes.disliked: — i was expecting more from the all inclusive

aka: Iberostar Praia Do Forte Hotel Mata De Sao Joao
description: A 5 star hotel located in Praia do Forte, only 60km away from Salvador (Brazil). Sea–turtles reserve. 5 restaurants. Tennis courts. SPA and Golf course.
